intro: Diporidium polycarpum, commonly known as the many-seeded diporidium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous tiny seeds. Diporidium polycarpum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
